RationalPiano.Graphic
Class GraphicControls

java.lang.Object
  RationalPiano.Graphic.GraphicControls
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDrawable, IGraphicControls
public class GraphicControls
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGraphicControls

Manages all screen elements, i.e. the background, the vertical lines (and in the future text and the parameter controls) Provides methods to draw, change and question those objects

Version:
1.02
Author:
Fabian Ehrentraud
Licence:
Licensed under the Open Software License (OSL 3.0)
Date:
2010-10-10

Constructor Detail

GraphicControls

public GraphicControls(processing.core.PApplet papplet,
                       java.lang.Boolean fullscreen,
                       int width,
                       int height,
                       float framerate,
                       int notecount,
                       int notestart,
                       double lineBend,
                       int backgroundColorHue,
                       int backgroundColorSaturation,
                       int backgroundColorBrightness,
                       int lineColorHueInactive,
                       int lineColorHueActive,
                       int lineColorSaturation,
                       int lineColorBrightness)
Initialize the drawing window and generate the controls

Parameters:
papplet - The processing applet to draw the elements to
fullscreen - Whether this PApplet runs in fullscreen mode. If true, width and height will get ignored and set to the screen size.
width - width of the window in pixels
height - height of the window in pixels
framerate - framerate of the window in frames per second
notecount - Count of Note Control Elements (Vertical Lines) to display, must be bigger than 0
notestart - Midi note number of the first note, the following notes get incremented numbers
lineBend - Nonlnearly transforms the set line widths; 0backgroundColorHue - Hue of the background color of the applet. 0<=backgroundColorHue<=255
backgroundColorSaturation - Saturation of the background color of the applet. 0<=backgroundColorSaturation<=255
backgroundColorBrightness - Brightness of the background color of the applet. 0<=backgroundColorBrightness<=255
lineColorHueInactive - Color hue of the lines that are not active. 0<=lineColorHueInactive<=255
lineColorHueActive - Color hue of the lines that are active. 0<=lineColorHueActive<=255
lineColorSaturation - Color saturation of the lines. 0<=lineColorSaturation<=255
lineColorBrightness - Color brightness of the lines. 0<=lineColorBrightness<=255
Method Detail

                   int width,

                   int notecount,

Initialize the drawing window and generate the controls

Parameters:
fullscreen - Whether this PApplet runs in fullscreen mode. If true, width and height will get ignored and set to the screen size.
width - width of the window in pixels
height - height of the window in pixels
framerate - framerate of the window in frames per second
notecount - Count of Note Control Elements (Vertical Lines) to display, must be bigger than 0
notestart - Midi note number of the first note, the following notes get incremented numbers
lineBend - Nonlnearly transforms the set line widths; 0backgroundColorHue - Hue of the background color of the applet. 0<=backgroundColorHue<=255
backgroundColorSaturation - Saturation of the background color of the applet. 0<=backgroundColorSaturation<=255
backgroundColorBrightness - Brightness of the background color of the applet. 0<=backgroundColorBrightness<=255
lineColorHueInactive - Color hue of the lines that are not active. 0<=lineColorHueInactive<=255
lineColorHueActive - Color hue of the lines that are active. 0<=lineColorHueActive<=255
lineColorSaturation - Color saturation of the lines. 0<=lineColorSaturation<=255
lineColorBrightness - Color brightness of the lines. 0<=lineColorBrightness<=255

draw

public void draw()
Description copied from interface: IDrawable
Draws this visual element or, if it is a container, all contained visual elements and the background. May be called with the framerate.

Specified by:
draw in interface IDrawable

getGraphicVisualizationElementArray

public IGraphicVisualizationElementArray getGraphicVisualizationElementArray()
Specified by:
getGraphicVisualizationElementArray in interface IGraphicControls
Returns:
The GraphicVisualizationElementArray containing the note visualization elements.
